description: An iconic iron tower in Paris, France, and a global symbol of romance and architecture.
A colossal statue on Liberty Island in New York City, symbolizing freedom and democracy.
A white marble mausoleum in India, built by Mughal emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife.
An ancient series of fortifications stretching across China, built to protect against invasions.
An ancient Incan city set high in the Andes Mountains of Peru, known for its archaeological beauty.
A Roman amphitheater in Rome, Italy, used for gladiator contests and public spectacles.
Ancient Egyptian pyramids located near Cairo, built as tombs for pharaohs.
The nickname for the Great Bell of the clock at the Palace of Westminster in London.
The tallest building in the world, located in Dubai, UAE.
A world-renowned performing arts center in Sydney, Australia, known for its sail-like design.
A sacred volcanic mountain in Japan, and the country's highest peak.
A group of massive waterfalls on the US-Canada border, famous for their beauty and power.
A Greek island known for its whitewashed buildings, blue domes, and stunning sunsets.
A vast and colorful canyon in Arizona, USA, carved by the Colorado River.
A large pre-Columbian archaeological site in Mexico, featuring the famous step pyramid El Castillo.
A prehistoric monument in England consisting of a ring of standing stones.
A giant statue of Jesus Christ in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, overlooking the city from Mount Corcovado.
An ancient rock-cut city in Jordan, famous for its rose-red sandstone architecture.

A massive temple complex in Cambodia, originally built as a Hindu temple for the Khmer Empire.
